paper_abstract: A new controllable-gain square rooting circuit using MOS transistors working in weak inversion is proposed. The proposed circuit can be configured to compute the geometric mean between two signals and the square root of the inverse of a signal. Tanner tool is used to confirm the functionality of the circuit in 0.18 A mu m CMOS TSMC process technology. Simulation results show a 3 dB bandwidth of 2 MHz and a relative error of about 2.4 %. The maximum power consumption is 1.73 A mu W. The proposed circuit is attractive for low power and low current applications.
paper_title: A new CMOS current-mode controllable-gain square rooting circuit using MOSFET in subthreshold
